item.description:
FREEDOM!!!

That's right lads and lasses, it's time to discover the Scot in us all. Whether you're a wanna be like myself, or have a clan heritage linking right back to the moors, we're off to experience the culture, music and athletics of the New Hampshire Highland Games.

Located at Loon Mtn the weekend of September 21-23, this is an opportunity to catch some amazing music, check out some sheepdog trials, and watch men in kilts lift heavy rocks and throw things. Don't worry, these particular fellas DO wear something underneath:-)

For a taste of the happenings (and to see the planned events and costs) explore their website at:

http://www.nhscot.org...

Day pass costs vary depending on the day. Weekend passes are available online for a reduced cost. Check the website for details.

The schedule is posted on the website, and current Meetup times and locations are based on two Saturday events:

9:00 a.m Highlander Games Professional Events on the Athletic Field
12 noon: Massed Bands and Opening Ceremonies on the parade grounds

More detailed info will be sent directly to those RSVP-ing 'yes' and 'maybe' about how to find us once there. Various other meeting times possible at either the cabins, or the events, depending on folks planned time of arrival.

There is no penalty for uncertainty this time around, so feel free to check Maybe if there's a chance you'll be joining us. Otherwise, you might be left on your own to find a Clan of your liking:-)

Reservations for overnight stay have been made at www.maplelodgecabins.com. We have a large cabin with a kitchen and living room that sleeps six and a neighboring cabin for two. Plenty of room for anyone who wants to crash for < 50 bucks per person per night.

Any questions? Contact Lisa (vetchick)
item.name: New Hampshire Highland Games
